answers.answer: The increase in your TG's is unrelated to catrate.  Elevated TG's are most likely related to your diet and the good news is that they are usually well controlled with diet modification.  Definitely cut down on your carbohydrate intake because that's what keeps the TG's elevated (the sugars get used up instead of the TG's).  If that does not help you should be started on therapy.  you should also have your cholesterol checked and treated as needed.  Occasionally, some patients have familial conditions which predispose them to developing elevated TG's.  The good news is that we can treat this with medications and diet.  Level greater than 500 are concerning and should be treated aggressively.
